title: Media report Michael Saylor is going to burn his private keys as he dies. See what he actually said
body: On Feb. 9, 2025, Cointelegraph published a clip of a January interview with Strategy chair Michael Saylor on Fox. According to the caption, in the video, Saylor hints he is going to burn his BTC keys as he dies to ensure the coins will never be sold. Let‚Äôs see what Saylor said, is there a hint, and what is the purpose of burning the keys. Several media channels reposted the clip from Cointelegraph, with various headlines, from which one could conclude the Strategy exec is indeed going to pull his stashes into the grave as he dies. However, that‚Äôs not what he said in the clip. üö® FOX BUSINESS: Michael Saylor hints that after his death, his Bitcoin keys will be destroyed, ensuring his BTC is never sold‚Äîcalling it a ‚Äúpro rata contribution‚Äù to all Bitcoin holders. pic.twitter.com/RhGgfIuvlq ‚Äî Cointelegraph (@Cointelegraph) February 9, 2025 In the video, Saylor says that it would be good for someone who has a lot of bitcoins to burn the keys to make a ‚Äúpro rata contribution‚Äù to all the BTC holders across the world ‚Äúbased on their contribution and their knowledge of Bitcoin.‚Äù The idea is simple ‚Äì due to the deflationary nature of Bitcoin, as a large amount of BTC leaves the circulation forever, the remaining bitcoins get more valuable. It means that the rest of the BTC holders may get richer as a result of the move. In this regard, Saylor‚Äôs idea is similar to Donald Trump‚Äôs urge not to sell bitcoins and accumulate them strategically. Various proposals for Bitcoin reserves have a clause forbidding the sale of BTC for years in order to ensure market stability and consistent demand. Although Saylor is definitely a person who accumulated much BTC, the way he put his idea doesn‚Äôt oblige him to follow the script he described. He didn‚Äôt add a single word that could be seen as a hint that he himself is going to lock his bitcoins forever. Rather, he shared the idea with others. And yes, there is a chance that Saylor is considering doing something like this. However, Saylor can come up with another decision in the future. He concluded that he sees himself as a person who took Satoshi‚Äôs torch and continues to commercialize Bitcoin with corporations and governments. How good is this idea? At least, the idea correlates with the vision of Satoshi Nakamoto, who created Bitcoin scarcity on purpose. When Saylor speaks about how great Bitcoin is, he often emphasizes its scarcity as the prime driver of its price. During the PBD Podcast episode in 2024, he said that he could create more real estate in New York City, create more watches, create more gold (sic!), and any kind of commodity if he had enough time and money. But Bitcoin has an absolute cap which is 21 million, said Saylor. As the commodity price goes up, the producers are incentivized to produce more, which is not the case with Bitcoin. That‚Äôs why Bitcoin is a great store of value, according to Saylor. He claims that the American dollar will be de facto-backed by Bitcoin as soon as the government starts to invest in it. In Saylor‚Äôs opinion, this will make the dollar more powerful, not less, as some experts warn. The reason is the same‚Äìas long as the country owns a huge chunk of the world‚Äôs BTC, its national currency will be strong. Nevertheless, it‚Äôs worth noting that scarcity drives the value of Bitcoin as long as demand for BTC stays strong. Let‚Äôs say someone draws a self-portrait, creating an extremely scarce item. Will it be extremely valuable? Not necessarily. Bitcoin is driven by demand. The growing scarcity of the asset boosts the demand further, increasing the urge of multiple entities (including corporations and governments) to acquire some. Let‚Äôs say someone with 450,000 BTC (an approximate amount in Saylor‚Äôs control as of January 2025) dies before the 2028 Bitcoin halving. In the 2024‚Äì2028 cycle, 450 BTC is produced every day. So, removing 450k bitcoins from circulation in one day eliminates the result of almost three years of mining between 2024 and 2028 or nearly everything that will be mined between 2028 and 2033. Some even compare this probable case to halving. However, unlike halving, a whale burning the keys is a different case. First off, unlike halving, it decreases the amount in circulation and second, it doesn‚Äôt involve miners having to raise BTC prices to keep mining profitability. However, the BTC buyers will have to compete for much fewer remaining bitcoins, which is a good climate for price growth. Generally, it seems that Saylor is right about the possible effect of such a move. However, there are some factors that may play his ‚Äúplan‚Äù around. The future of lost bitcoins As of February 2025, over three million of the 20 million bitcoins that are already mined are considered ‚Äúlost‚Äù due to forgotten or lost keys, coins sent to wrong addresses, and other reasons. According to other estimations, there are over 6 million lost bitcoins out there. You might also like: Nearly one-third of Bitcoin‚Äôs circulating supply possibly lost: report Although so many lost coins make Bitcoin even scarcer, the fate of these coins is not that conclusive. The very concept of a 21 million hard cap is not something unchangeable. The same mechanism that is used to improve the Bitcoin network can change the total supply of bitcoins or remove it altogether. This possibly was mentioned in an educational video on Bitcoin released by BlackRock, a company that has the largest amount of BTC. This unorthodox fact was met with anger and disapproval from the community, however, it doesn‚Äôt change the very fact that the hard cap can be changed if enough miners see this idea favorably, for any reason. If the hard cap goes away or the total supply increases, the value of lost bitcoins may drop and Saylor‚Äôs vision turns out to be false. Another concern is quantum computers. Quantum computers are one of the concerning technologies that are expected to drastically change the game as soon as they enter the scope. Quantum computers will be able to recover all lost coins, including Satoshi's if he's no longer living. Saylor better come up with a better plan than burying his keys with him. ‚Äî LiveLifeWellNC (@30flygirl1) February 9, 2025 Their computational abilities may be strong enough to break BTC wallets. The Bitcoin community is preparing to prevent this but the outcome is not known as of now. There is a possibility that ‚Äúlost‚Äù bitcoins will be freed or stolen via quantum computers. title: Scarlett Johansson calls for laws to limit AI after viral fake video condemning Kanye West
body: Scarlett Johansson has called on US lawmakers to limit the use of AI after an unauthorized deepfake video of her likeness and several other Jewish celebrities went viral on social media. The video features an AI-generated version of the 40-year-old Hollywood actress alongside over a dozen other popular Jewish A-listers appearing to oppose rapper Kanye West‚Äôs recent antisemitic outburst on X. Scarlett Johansson denounces AI misuse Johansson is shown wearing a white T-shirt with an image of a hand flipping its middle finger. West, now Ye, went on a rant against Jews last weekend and even started selling Swastika T-shirts on his website. ‚ÄúIt has been brought to my attention by family members and friends that an AI-generated video featuring my likeness‚Ä¶has been circulating online and gaining traction,‚Äù Johansson told People on Wednesday. ‚ÄúI am a Jewish woman who has no tolerance for antisemitism or hate speech of any kind. But I also firmly believe that the potential for hate speech multiplied by AI is a far greater threat than any one person who takes accountability for it. We must call out the misuse of AI, no matter its messaging, or we risk losing a hold on reality.‚Äù The video clip ‚Äì reportedly created by Israeli generative AI expert Ori Bejerano, also features 20 AI versions of stars including Adam Sandler, Mila Kunis, Drake, Jerry Seinfeld, Steven Spielberg, Mark Zuckerberg, Sacha Baron Cohen, Jack Black, Lenny Kravitz, Ben Stiller, and David Schwimmer. In the video, the stars are wearing white T-shirts with the middle finger flipped off and a Star of David in the middle of the hand with Kanye‚Äôs name below it. In the end, the video declares that ‚ÄúEnough is Enough‚Äù and urges viewers to ‚ÄúJoin the Fight Against Antisemitism‚Äù. In her statement, Johansson lamented how she has been ‚Äúa very public victim of artificial intelligence‚Äù. But she also warned that the ‚Äúthreat of AI affects each and every one of us.‚Äù ‚ÄúThere is a 1000-foot wave coming regarding AI that several progressive countries, not including the United States, have responded to in a responsible manner,‚Äù she detailed. ‚ÄúI urge the US government to make the passing of legislation limiting AI use a top priority; it is a bipartisan issue that enormously affects the immediate future of humanity at large.‚Äù Johansson. Johansson also said it was worrisome to note that the US government is ‚Äúparalyzed when it comes to passing legislation that protects all of its citizens against the imminent dangers of AI.‚Äù The star has been caught up in AI controversy before This is not the first time that the ‚ÄúFly Me to the Moon‚Äù star has had to deal with AI stealing her likeness. In May 2024, she criticized OpenAI after it emerged that the ChatGPT voice, Sky, resembled Johansson‚Äôs. OpenAI said Sky‚Äôs voice was ‚Äúnot an imitation of Johansson‚Äù but went on to suspend the voice anyway. And in November 2023, Johansson threatened to sue a company that used her likeness to create an advert. ‚ÄúThe video included images produced by Lisa AI. It has nothing to do with this person,‚Äù the company denied the allegations. While Johansson is the only star in the fake video to speak against the Kanye West sentiments, other stars have previously aired their concerns. For instance, over the weekend before his Super Bowl ad aired, ‚ÄúFriends‚Äù actor David Schwimmer begged Elon Musk to block Kanye from X. ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt stop a deranged bigot from spewing hate-filled, ignorant bile‚Ä¶ but we CAN stop giving him a megaphone, Mr. Musk,‚Äù Schwimmer wrote on Instagram . ‚ÄúKanye West has 32.7 million followers on your platform, X. That‚Äôs twice as many people than the number of Jews in existence. His sick hate speech results in REAL LIFE violence against Jews,‚Äù added Schwimmer. According to CNN , Kanye West deactivated his X account on Sunday. title: Adobe unveils AI video generator at 50 cents per clip to compete with startups
body: Adobe has launched an AI video generator that creates short video clips for 50 cents per video. With these low costs, Adobe aims to compete with other AI startups like OpenAI and integrate artificial intelligence into its creative software package. Generate Video is available in public beta, following a limited early access testing period last year. The beta tool can be accessed via the redesigned Firefly web app, alongside new image generation and translation capabilities and AI credit subscription tiers for creators. Adobe added some minor improvements since it was first teased in September . Adobe lowers AI video pricing to compete with industry giants On Wednesday, Adobe unveiled its latest software, which creates 5-second videos with artificial intelligence for only 50 cents per video. In an attempt to compete with giants like OpenAI and Runway, Adobe is offering separate AI-specific subscriptions for only $9.99 and $29.99. Ely Greenfield, chief technology officer of Adobe‚Äôs creative software business, noted that the affordable prices serve to increase adoption rates while staying competitive and that the math speaks for itself. We‚Äôre pricing it at a lower point right now for adoption. If you do the math and look what‚Äôs out there, we‚Äôre competitive in the marketplace. Ely Greenfield This move most likely resulted from the massive 25% drop in Adobe‚Äôs shares in 2024, when investors feared that AI startups might subdue the company. Since then, the company has been integrating generative AI features into its star applications, like Photoshop. The computer software company began launching tools powered by its generative AI Firefly Video Model at the end of 2024, starting with the Generative Extend tool in beta for Premiere Pro that can be used to extend the end or beginning of footage. Adobe integrates AI into creative tools to compete with Runway and OpenAI Adobe‚Äôs Generate Video tool rollout comes a few weeks after OpenAI launched its own text-to-video generator, Sora, to ChatGPT paid subscribers, allowing them to generate AI videos using prompts. Runway charges users 70 cents to $1.20 to generate a 5-second video using its newest AI model and has an unlimited plan for $95 per month. Adobe faces growing competition in the AI video market. In addition to Sora, Google is testing the second generation of its Veo AI video model, which, judging by early demo examples, looks more impressive than OpenAI‚Äôs model. ByteDance and Pika Labs have also recently announced new video-focused generative AI tools. Offloading activity to these upstart networks has helped bring down fees and improve speeds for end-users, but it has led to a massive, deeply fragmented ecosystem of layer 2s. But while layer-2 networks all post data back down to Ethereum, they often struggle to communicate directly with one another, meaning passing assets and data between them can become expensive and cumbersome. There's also the risk of centralized sequencers: reliance on company-controlled black boxes to pass transaction data between blockchain layers. As a result, some Ethereum developers are pushing rollup tech that takes a new approach to security and interoperability: ‚Äúbased rollups." Based rollups differ from most existing rollups because they shift execution duties‚Äîsuch as processing transactions‚Äîback to Ethereum's layer-1 rather than handling them on a separate layer-2 network. When someone transacts on a layer-2 rollup, their transaction is processed through a component called a ‚Äúsequencer.‚Äù The sequencer batches multiple transactions and submits them to Ethereum for settlement. While sequencers provide efficiency and generate revenue for rollup operators by strategically ordering transactions, they also introduce a single point of failure. Based rollups avoid this vulnerability by using Ethereum‚Äôs built-in sequencing‚Äîits massive community of validators‚Äîrather than a single centralized sequencer. Rollups like Optimism, Arbitrum, Base, zkSync, and Blast have quickly grown to support larger transaction volumes than Ethereum itself. According to L2Beat , there are currently 140 live layer-2 networks, but the experience of operating between them‚Äîpassing assets and other data between networks‚Äîhas become clunky. As Ethereum becomes bigger and layer-2 networks become more integral to its functioning, improving communication between layer-2s‚Äîin other words, improving "composability"‚Äîhas become more important than ever. ‚Äî Margaux Nijkerk Read more. LIDO GOES MODULAR: The developers behind Lido, the largest staking service on Ethereum, have proposed revamping the staking platform with modular "vaults." The new framework would introduce stVaults, a customizable component designed to help Lido accommodate institutions and more complex staking strategies. Lido currently allows investors to pool their ether (ETH) together and "stake" their crypto ‚Äî locking up their tokens with the network, helping to secure it in exchange for interest. Lido pioneered liquid staking: users get a receipt on their deposits called Lido staked ETH (stETH) that they can trade at any time. With liquid staking on Lido, entering and exiting staking positions became as simple as buying and selling stETH tokens. Lido V3's stVaults are ‚Äúmodular smart contracts designed to meet the diverse and evolving needs of Ethereum participants,‚Äù according to a press release shared with CoinDesk. The upgrade would enable staking setups beyond cut-and-dry liquid staking. Specifically, stVaults will be able to help institutional stakers who want to personalize their staking setups, node operators who want to attract high-volume stakers, and asset managers who want to create new staking use cases. ‚ÄúWhat is important to understand with customizable infrastructure, is that you can in general build even more complex products,‚Äù said Konstantin Lomashuk, the founder of the Lido staking protocol. ‚Äî Margaux Nijkerk Read more. UNICHAIN FINALLY: Uniswap Labs, the primary developer behind one of the largest decentralized exchanges (DEX), Uniswap, shared Feb 13 that its long-awaited layer-2 network, Unichain, is now live. Powered by Optimism's OP stack, Unichain‚Äîlike other layer-2s on Ethereum‚Äîoffers faster and cheaper transactions compared to Ethereum's mainnet. Developers can deploy apps onto the network, which has been optimized specifically for decentralized finance (DeFi) and aims to serve as "the home for liquidity across chains," according to Uniswap Labs. For Uniswap Labs, the benefit of launching a layer-2 is twofold: it will provide a better experience for users of Uniswap and similar platforms, and it will create a new revenue opportunity in the form of network fees. A representative for Uniswap Labs told CoinDesk that "around 20%" of the chain's revenue will go directly to the company. Unichain has been in testing since October 2024 and is classified by Uniswap Labs as a "stage-1" rollup, meaning it has elements of decentralization but retains some centrally-controlled safeguards at this early phase. The network is built on the OP Stack, a modular framework that lets developers build interoperable layer-2 chains based on Optimism‚Äôs optimistic rollup technology . Several well-known teams have come out with their own OP Stack-based layer-2‚Äôs, including Coinbase's ‚Äò Base ‚Äô, Kraken‚Äôs ‚Äò Ink ,‚Äô World‚Äôs ‚Äò World chain ,‚Äô and Sony‚Äôs ‚Äò Soneium .‚Äô ‚ÄúWe are anticipating a world of many, many different use cases, of which trading is a small subset,‚Äù Adams told CoinDesk in an interview. In collaboration with Ethereum research and development firm Flashbots, the Uniswap team said it has created a Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) on Unichain, a secure area for more sensitive transactions and is meant to optimize the chain for DeFi by allowing for more advanced trades and faster transaction finality. ‚Äî Margaux Nijkerk Read more. PECTRA IN APRIL: Ethereum developers have officially set test dates for Pectra, the network's first upgrade in 11 months, putting it on track for a potential April release date. Pectra will contain an array of improvements ‚Äî with a special focus on wallets and validators ‚Äî but it comes at a period of heightened scrutiny for Ethereum, which has recently faced pressure from its community to refocus and catch up with competitors. Ethereum's core builders decided on Thursday during their bi-weekly "All Core Developers" call to begin testing Pectra on Feb. 26 on the Holesky testnet, with a follow-up test on the network's Sepolia testnet slated for Mar. 5. Should those tests succeed, the developers will reconvene on Mar. 6 to determine when to launch the upgrade officially. According to Tim Beiko, the protocol support lead at the Ethereum Foundation, developers expect the upgrade to hit mainnet in early April. Pectra ‚Äî a portmanteau representing two separate upgrades, Prague and Electra ‚Äî includes eight major improvements to the second-largest blockchain. Among the most-anticipated is EIP-7702, which is supposed to improve the user experience of crypto wallets. The Ethereum community has been facing an identity crisis over the last few weeks. Its native token, ether (ETH), is underperforming against other cryptocurrencies, and competitor networks like Solana have drawn attention and talent from the Ethereum ecosystem ‚Äî the first-ever programmable blockchain and still the most trafficked. Amid the controversy ‚Äî much of it directed at the Etheruem Foundation, which coordinates chain upgrades and is currently undergoing a major leadership shuffle ‚Äî developers are hoping that Pectra will help put the network on steadier footing. ‚Äî Margaux Nijkerk Read more. title: World Liberty Financial Zach Witkoff X Hacked To Push Fake Barron Memecoin
body: A hacker took control of the X account of Zach Witkoff, co-founder of World Liberty Financial, and used it to promote a fake Barron Trump-themed memecoin. The fraudulent project, called $BARRON, quickly surged in market value before crashing within seconds. World Liberty Financial Co Founder X Account Hacked World Liberty Financial, a decentralized finance project linked to the Trump family, has confirmed that its co founder Zach Witkoff X account has been breached and urged users to ignore the fraudulent posts. On Wednesday, Witkoff‚Äôs compromised X account was used to promote $BARRON, a Solana-based memecoin falsely linked to President Donald Trump‚Äôs youngest son, Barron Trump. The hacker claimed that Trump would soon confirm the token‚Äôs legitimacy. However, according to World Liberty Financial, ‚ÄúZach Witkoff‚Äôs account was compromised. Please do not engage with any posts promoting this project,‚Äù the company posted on X. The coin briefly reached a market capitalization of $73 million in under ten minutes before suddenly plummeting by 99%. This rapid rise and collapse indicated a ‚Äúrug pull,‚Äù a scam where creators artificially inflate a token‚Äôs value before dumping it for profit. Previous Trump-Themed Memecoin Scams World Liberty Financial, which is launching a macro strategy reserve for crypto , was founded in 2024 and launched its own cryptocurrency, WLFI, in October of the same year. Several members of the Trump family, including Barron Trump, are listed as part of the project‚Äôs team. The $BARRON incident follows a similar scam in January involving a memecoin named after Ivanka Trump. The former president‚Äôs daughter publicly distanced herself from the project and warned investors against fraudulent schemes using her likeness. Memecoins featuring the Trump family have gained traction since Donald Trump announced his own cryptocurrency, Official Trump, on Solana in January. Days later, Melania Trump launched Melania Meme, also on the Solana blockchain. Memecoin Scams and Growing Concerns The rise of celebrity-themed memecoins has raised concerns about misleading promotions and scams in the cryptocurrency market. Binance founder Changpeng Zhao (CZ) commented on the growing trend, questioning how investors determine the legitimacy of such tokens. ‚ÄúHow does this work? I share my dog‚Äôs name and picture, and then people create memecoins?‚Äù Zhao wrote on X. ‚ÄúHow do you know which one is ‚Äòofficial‚Äô? Or does that even matter?‚Äù According to experts, memecoins have gained popularity due to their viral nature and speculative appeal, but they also pose risks to investors. Many projects lack transparency, and sudden sell-offs, commonly known as ‚Äúrug pulls,‚Äù can lead to significant financial losses. Despite these concerns, the US SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce, in a February 11 interview, stated that most memecoins do not fall under the SEC‚Äôs current regulatory framework. ‚ÄúMany of the memecoins that are out there probably do not have a home in the SEC under our current set of regulations,‚Äù Peirce said. title: Alarming Bitcoin Confirmation Times Soar to Record 19 Minutes: What‚Äôs Behind the Crypto Gridlock?
body: Are your Bitcoin transactions feeling slower than ever? You‚Äôre not alone. Recent reports indicate a significant slowdown in the Bitcoin network, with average Bitcoin confirmation times reaching an unprecedented 19 minutes. This alarming development, reported by Cointelegraph on X, has sparked concern and curiosity within the crypto community. Let‚Äôs dive into what‚Äôs causing these Bitcoin transaction delays and what it means for you. Why Are Bitcoin Confirmation Times Skyrocketing? Several factors contribute to the current surge in Bitcoin confirmation times . It‚Äôs a perfect storm of network dynamics, highlighting both the strengths and limitations of the Bitcoin blockchain. Here‚Äôs a breakdown: Network Congestion: Think of the Bitcoin network as a digital highway. When more transactions are submitted than the network can handle efficiently, traffic jams occur. This network congestion is a primary driver of longer confirmation times. Increased user activity, perhaps due to market volatility or new adoption waves, can quickly clog the network. Block Size Limits: Bitcoin‚Äôs blockchain operates with a block size limit of roughly 1MB. This constraint, designed for security and decentralization, means that only a limited number of transactions can be included in each block mined approximately every 10 minutes. When transaction volume exceeds block capacity, a backlog forms, leading to delays. Fee Dynamics: In Bitcoin, users attach fees to their transactions to incentivize miners to prioritize them. Transactions with higher fees are generally processed faster. When network congestion is high, users often need to increase their fees to ensure timely confirmation. However, this creates a competitive fee market, potentially pricing out users with lower fee tolerance and further contributing to overall delays. Understanding Bitcoin Transaction Delays: A Closer Look To truly grasp the impact of these delays, let‚Äôs break down what Bitcoin confirmation times mean and why they matter: Aspect Description Impact of Increased Confirmation Times Confirmation Time The time it takes for a Bitcoin transaction to be included in a block and considered verified by the network. Longer wait times for transactions to finalize. Network Throughput The number of transactions the Bitcoin network can process per second. Reduced throughput means the network struggles to keep up with demand, leading to backlogs. User Experience The overall ease and speed of using Bitcoin for transactions. Frustration for users expecting quick and efficient transactions, especially in time-sensitive situations like point-of-sale purchases. Fee Market The competitive environment where users bid transaction fees to get their transactions processed faster. Higher fees become necessary for faster confirmations, increasing the cost of using Bitcoin, particularly during peak congestion. What Does This Mean for Crypto Users? The record-high Bitcoin confirmation times present both challenges and opportunities for crypto users: Challenges: Slower Transactions: The most immediate impact is the increased wait time for transactions to be confirmed. This can be inconvenient for everyday use cases, especially when speed is crucial. Higher Fees: To expedite transactions during congestion, users may need to pay higher fees, making Bitcoin potentially less cost-effective for smaller transactions. Uncertainty: Longer confirmation times can introduce uncertainty, particularly in volatile markets where timely execution of trades is important. Opportunities & Actionable Insights: Layer-2 Solutions: This situation highlights the importance of Layer-2 solutions like the Lightning Network, which offer faster and cheaper Bitcoin transactions. Exploring and adopting these solutions can mitigate the impact of mainnet congestion. Fee Awareness: Understanding Bitcoin fee dynamics becomes crucial. Using fee estimators and adjusting fees based on network conditions can help optimize transaction speed and cost. Patience and Planning: For less time-sensitive transactions, patience is key. Planning transactions ahead and avoiding peak congestion times can help reduce delays. Consider Alternatives (Strategically): In situations where extremely fast and low-cost transactions are paramount, users might temporarily consider other cryptocurrencies with faster confirmation times and lower fees, while still holding Bitcoin for its store of value properties. Are There Solutions to Bitcoin Network Congestion? Addressing network congestion and improving crypto transaction speed on Bitcoin is an ongoing discussion within the community. Potential solutions and improvements include: Block Size Increase (Controversial): Increasing the block size limit could theoretically allow more transactions per block. However, this is a contentious topic with potential implications for decentralization and node operation. Segregated Witness (SegWit): Already implemented, SegWit optimized block space and increased transaction capacity to some extent. Further adoption and optimization can still contribute. Understanding the causes behind these Bitcoin transaction delays , exploring Layer-2 solutions, and practicing fee awareness are crucial steps for users to navigate this evolving landscape effectively. body: Are you trying to navigate the volatile cryptocurrency market and looking for an edge? Understanding market sentiment is crucial, and one powerful tool in your arsenal is the Bitcoin long-short ratio. This metric offers a glimpse into the collective positioning of traders in the perpetual futures market, helping you gauge whether the majority are leaning bullish or bearish on Bitcoin. Let‚Äôs dive into the latest 24-hour Bitcoin long-short ratio data and decode what it means for you. Decoding the 24-Hour BTC Futures Long-Short Ratio For the past 24 hours, the overall Bitcoin long-short ratio across major cryptocurrency exchanges paints a picture of near equilibrium. Binance and Bybit show a slightly higher inclination towards short positions, while Bitget leans marginally towards long positions. The differences, however, are minimal, reinforcing the overall picture of a market in relative balance regarding BTC futures . Why is the Bitcoin Long-Short Ratio Important for Crypto Traders? Understanding the Bitcoin long-short ratio offers several benefits for crypto traders: Gauge Market Sentiment: The ratio acts as a sentiment indicator. A significantly higher long ratio might suggest excessive bullishness (potential market top), while a high short ratio could indicate extreme fear (potential bottom). Identify Potential Reversals: Extreme long or short ratios can sometimes precede market reversals. For example, if everyone is long, there might be fewer buyers left to push prices higher, increasing the likelihood of a correction. Confirmation Tool: Use the ratio to confirm signals from other technical indicators or fundamental analysis. If your analysis suggests a bullish move, and the long ratio is also increasing, it can add conviction to your trade. Risk Management: Understanding the prevailing sentiment can help you manage risk. Knowing if the market is heavily leaning in one direction can inform your position sizing and stop-loss placement. Navigating Perpetual Futures with Long-Short Ratios Perpetual futures are derivative contracts that, unlike traditional futures, do not have an expiry date. This makes them popular for traders who want to hold positions for longer durations or engage in strategies like hedging. The Bitcoin long-short ratio is particularly relevant for perpetual futures because it reflects the ongoing sentiment and positioning in these contracts. Here‚Äôs how to effectively use the Bitcoin long-short ratio when trading perpetual futures: Monitor Trends: Track the ratio over time. A consistent increase in the long ratio could signal growing bullishness, while a rising short ratio might indicate increasing bearishness. Compare Across Exchanges: Look for discrepancies in ratios across different exchanges. Significant variations could highlight localized sentiment or potential arbitrage opportunities. Combine with Other Data: Don‚Äôt rely solely on the long-short ratio. Use it in conjunction with price action, volume analysis, open interest, and other on-chain metrics for a comprehensive market view. Challenges in Interpreting Crypto Market Sentiment While the Bitcoin long-short ratio is a valuable tool, it‚Äôs important to acknowledge its limitations: Exchange Specific Data: The reported ratios are usually specific to individual exchanges. The total ratio is an aggregation, but it might not represent the entire global market perfectly. Lagging Indicator: Like many sentiment indicators, the long-short ratio is somewhat lagging. It reflects past positioning and might not predict immediate future price movements. Manipulation Potential: In less regulated markets, there‚Äôs always a potential for manipulation. Large players could potentially influence the ratio to create misleading signals, although this is less likely on major, reputable exchanges. Context is Key: The interpretation of the ratio depends heavily on market context. A 60% long ratio in a bull market might be normal, but the same ratio in a bear market could be considered excessively bullish and risky. Actionable Insights for Bitcoin Trading So, what actionable insights can we derive from the current Bitcoin long-short ratio data? Neutral Market Stance: The near 50/50 split suggests a market in indecision. Traders are not overwhelmingly bullish or bearish at this moment. Cautious Trading: In such balanced conditions, consider adopting a more cautious trading approach. Avoid over-leveraging and be prepared for potential volatility in either direction. Focus on Price Action: Pay close attention to price action and technical patterns. In a neutral sentiment environment, price movements might be more technically driven. Monitor for Shifts: Keep an eye on how the Bitcoin long-short ratio evolves over the coming hours and days. A significant shift towards either long or short could signal the beginning of a new trend. Conclusion: Staying Informed in the Crypto Landscape In the fast-paced world of cryptocurrency trading, staying informed is paramount. By monitoring this metric, along with other market indicators, you can enhance your trading strategy and navigate the exciting, yet challenging, crypto landscape with greater confidence. title: Revolutionary Move: Toyota Finance Issues Corporate Bonds as Security Tokens in Japan
body: In a groundbreaking move that signals a significant shift in traditional finance, Toyota Financial Services (TFS), the financial powerhouse behind the globally recognized Toyota automotive brand, is diving headfirst into the world of blockchain technology. They are set to issue corporate bonds in the innovative form of security tokens . This exciting development, slated for March 3rd, is not just a solo venture; it‚Äôs a collaborative symphony of financial giants including Daiwa Securities, MUFG Bank, Mitsubishi UFJ Trust and Banking Corporation, and the blockchain platform Progmat. Let‚Äôs delve into what this means for the future of finance and why this is a game-changer you need to know about. What are Security Tokens and Why Toyota is Choosing Them? Security tokens are essentially digital representations of traditional financial securities, like stocks or bonds, but they live on a blockchain. Think of them as the next evolution of financial assets, bringing together the security of regulated securities with the efficiency and transparency of blockchain technology. But why are established giants like Toyota Financial Services choosing this route? Enhanced Efficiency and Speed: Blockchain technology promises faster settlement times and streamlined processes compared to traditional bond issuance. Imagine transactions settling in minutes rather than days! Increased Accessibility: Security tokens can potentially lower the barrier to entry for investors, allowing for fractional ownership and broader market participation. This could open up corporate bond investments to a wider range of investors. Improved Transparency: Every transaction on the blockchain is recorded and immutable, offering a higher level of transparency for both issuers and investors. This reduces information asymmetry and builds trust. Reduced Costs: By automating many manual processes involved in traditional bond issuance, security tokens can lead to significant cost savings for issuers like Toyota Finance. For Toyota Finance, a company synonymous with innovation and efficiency in the automotive industry, embracing security tokens for corporate bond issuance aligns perfectly with their ethos. It‚Äôs a bold step into the future of finance, showcasing their commitment to leveraging cutting-edge technology. The Power of Tokenization in Corporate Finance The process of converting rights to an asset into a digital token is known as tokenization . This isn‚Äôt just about creating digital versions of existing assets; it‚Äôs about unlocking new possibilities and efficiencies within the financial system. In the context of corporate bonds, tokenization offers a plethora of benefits: Benefit Description Impact on Corporate Bonds Fractional Ownership Tokens can be divided into smaller units, allowing multiple investors to own a fraction of a bond. Democratizes investment, enabling smaller investors to participate in corporate bond markets. 24/7 Trading Blockchain-based assets can be traded around the clock, unlike traditional markets with set hours. Increases liquidity and provides flexibility for global investors. Smart Contracts Automated contracts embedded in the blockchain can streamline processes like interest payments and maturity payouts. Reduces administrative overhead and ensures timely and accurate payments. Global Reach Security tokens can be accessible to investors worldwide, expanding the investor base for corporate bonds. Facilitates cross-border investments and diversifies funding sources. Toyota Finance‚Äôs foray into tokenization of corporate bonds is a testament to the transformative potential of this technology in reshaping corporate finance. It‚Äôs about making financial instruments more accessible, efficient, and globally connected. Blockchain: The Backbone of Security Token Issuance At the heart of this revolution lies blockchain technology. A blockchain is a decentralized, distributed, and immutable ledger that records transactions in blocks linked together chronologically. This technology provides the infrastructure for security tokens to operate securely and transparently. Key features of blockchain that make it ideal for security token issuance: Decentralization: No single entity controls the blockchain, reducing the risk of censorship or single points of failure. Immutability: Once a transaction is recorded on the blockchain, it cannot be altered or deleted, ensuring data integrity and trust. Transparency: Transaction records are publicly auditable (depending on the type of blockchain), enhancing transparency and accountability. Security: Cryptographic techniques secure the blockchain network, making it highly resistant to fraud and hacking. By leveraging blockchain , Toyota Finance and its partners are building a robust and secure foundation for their security token issuance, ensuring investor confidence and operational efficiency. Why Japan is Becoming a Hotspot for Security Tokens Japan is emerging as a progressive hub for blockchain innovation and digital asset adoption, creating a fertile ground for security token initiatives like Toyota‚Äôs. Several factors contribute to Japan‚Äôs growing prominence in this space: Pro-regulatory Environment: The Japanese government has been proactive in establishing clear regulatory frameworks for cryptocurrencies and digital assets, providing legal clarity and fostering innovation. Tech-Savvy Population: Japan has a high level of technological adoption and a population comfortable with digital innovations, creating a receptive market for security tokens. Financial Innovation Focus: Japanese financial institutions are increasingly exploring and investing in fintech solutions, including blockchain and digital assets, to enhance their services and competitiveness. Strong Financial Infrastructure: Japan boasts a robust financial infrastructure and a deep pool of institutional investors, creating a supportive ecosystem for the growth of the security token market. Toyota Finance launching its security token corporate bonds in Japan is strategically significant, capitalizing on the country‚Äôs favorable regulatory landscape and vibrant fintech ecosystem. This move could inspire other Japanese corporations to explore security token offerings. The Collaborative Effort: Key Players Behind Toyota‚Äôs Security Token Bonds The success of Toyota Finance‚Äôs security token issuance hinges on the collaborative expertise of several key players: Toyota Financial Services (TFS): As the issuer, TFS is taking the pioneering step to tokenize its corporate bonds, demonstrating leadership in financial innovation. Daiwa Securities: A leading Japanese securities firm, Daiwa Securities brings its expertise in traditional bond markets and regulatory compliance to the security token offering. MUFG Bank & Mitsubishi UFJ Trust and Banking Corporation: These banking giants provide crucial banking and trust services, ensuring the seamless integration of security tokens within the existing financial infrastructure. Progmat: As a blockchain platform provider, Progmat offers the technological backbone for issuing and managing security tokens, ensuring a secure and efficient platform. Leading crypto expert Matt Hougan, CIO of Bitwise, has highlighted a striking split in crypto sentiment : Institutional investors are charging in with bullish conviction, while retail investors are showing historic levels of pessimism. Could this unusual dynamic be the secret signal for the next big alt season ? Let‚Äôs dive into this intriguing market scenario. Decoding the Crypto Sentiment Divide: Bullish Institutions vs. Cautious Retail The cryptocurrency market is rarely monolithic. Currently, it‚Äôs displaying a stark contrast in investor behavior. On one side, we have institutional investors , the big players with deep pockets, demonstrating unwavering optimism. On the other, retail investors , the everyday crypto enthusiasts, are exhibiting caution, even pessimism. This divergence isn‚Äôt just interesting; it could be a key indicator of future market movements. Institutional Investors: Riding the Bullish Wave Let‚Äôs break down why institutions are so bullish: Record ETF Inflows: Crypto ETFs, particularly Bitcoin ETFs, are seeing unprecedented inflows of capital. This signifies strong institutional demand and a willingness to allocate significant funds to crypto assets. Growing Institutional Adoption: Major corporations, traditional financial institutions, and even sovereign wealth funds are increasingly exploring and investing in cryptocurrencies. This broad adoption validates crypto as a legitimate asset class. Long-Term Vision: Institutions often operate with a longer investment horizon. They are less swayed by short-term volatility and more focused on the long-term potential of blockchain technology and digital assets. Retail Investors: Navigating Altcoin Underperformance In contrast, retail sentiment is lagging. Why the caution? Altcoin Underperformance: While Bitcoin has shown resilience and even growth, many altcoins have struggled. This underperformance can erode retail investor confidence, who often gravitate towards altcoins for higher potential gains (and losses). Market Fatigue: After periods of market volatility and uncertainty, retail investors can experience fatigue and become risk-averse. The perceived lack of immediate, substantial gains in altcoins can contribute to this pessimism. Focus on Bitcoin Dominance: Bitcoin‚Äôs strong performance often overshadows the altcoin market. When Bitcoin dominates, it can create a perception that altcoins are less attractive or riskier investments. The Alt Season Opportunity: Is Pessimism the Perfect Setup? Here‚Äôs where things get interesting. Matt Hougan suggests that this very pessimism amongst retail investors, coupled with strong institutional demand, could be the perfect breeding ground for an alt season . Why? Contrarian Indicator: Often, the best investment opportunities arise when sentiment is low. When everyone is bearish, it can signal that the market is oversold and ripe for a reversal. Pent-Up Demand: Retail investors may be sitting on the sidelines, but their interest in altcoins hasn‚Äôt vanished. If market conditions improve and positive catalysts emerge, this pent-up demand could fuel a significant altcoin rally. Market Fundamentals Strengthening: Hougan points out that market fundamentals are indeed strengthening. Increased adoption, technological advancements, and growing use cases are laying a solid foundation for future growth in the broader crypto market, including altcoins. Bitcoin Price: The Catalyst for Altcoin Rally? Bitcoin price plays a crucial role in the altcoin narrative. Hougan believes that Bitcoin‚Äôs supply-demand dynamics are exceptionally strong, potentially driving its price to new all-time highs. How does this relate to altcoins? Bitcoin as the Market Leader: Bitcoin often acts as the bellwether for the crypto market. A strong Bitcoin performance can boost overall market confidence and investor sentiment, creating a more favorable environment for altcoins. Capital Rotation: Historically, after Bitcoin experiences a significant rally, profits often rotate into altcoins. Investors may seek higher-risk, higher-reward opportunities in altcoins once Bitcoin has established a strong uptrend. Increased Liquidity: A rising Bitcoin price can inject more liquidity into the entire crypto market. This increased liquidity can benefit altcoins, making it easier for them to rally. Research Promising Altcoins: Don‚Äôt just chase hype. Focus on altcoins with strong fundamentals, innovative technology, and real-world use cases. Diversify Your Portfolio: Don‚Äôt put all your eggs in one basket. Diversify your crypto portfolio across different asset classes, including Bitcoin and select altcoins. Manage Risk Wisely: Altcoins are inherently more volatile than Bitcoin. Invest only what you can afford to lose and use risk management strategies like stop-loss orders. Patience is Key: Alt seasons don‚Äôt happen overnight. Be prepared to hold your altcoin investments for the medium to long term to realize their potential. Conclusion: Is the Crypto Market Primed for an Exciting Turnaround? The current crypto landscape presents a fascinating paradox. While retail crypto sentiment may be subdued due to recent altcoin performance, the underlying strength of institutional investors and the bullish outlook on Bitcoin price suggest a compelling narrative. Matt Hougan‚Äôs analysis points towards a potential alt season brewing beneath the surface of market pessimism. By understanding these dynamics and acting strategically, investors can position themselves to potentially capitalize on the next wave of crypto market growth. The secret signal might just be the sentiment divide itself ‚Äì a contrarian indicator whispering of opportunity amidst the caution. title: Brian Armstrong says billions of people will use Bitcoin by 2030. Why is it possible?
body: Commenting on an X post about the high speed of crypto adoption, Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said that several billion people will be using Bitcoin by 2030. Armstrong was commenting on a post that shares the statistics from the recent BlackRock study. It says that crypto hit the 300 million users landmark in just 12 years. Allegedly, it is 43% quicker than a mobile phone adoption and 20% quicker than an Internet adoption. It really depends what you count as the official start year ‚Äì for Bitcoin, Internet, and mobile phones ‚Äì to make this comparison. But regardless, this is directionally correct. Bitcoin adoption should get to several billion people by 2030 at current rates. https://t.co/JEU8P7YmLP ‚Äî Brian Armstrong (@brian_armstrong) February 10, 2025 Reposting this post, Armstrong added that the estimation may vary depending on what we see as the starting day of the Internet or mobile phone adoption, but he agrees with the overall direction of the BlackRock findings. Coinbase CEO concluded that by 2030, several billion people will be using Bitcoin. You might also like: Crypto adoption beats mobile phones by 43% and Internet by 20%, reports BlackRock BlackRock study According to a BlackRock study released in January 2025, Bitcoin experienced rapid adoption, quickly attracting the attention of both individual and institutional investors. The study stresses the increasing relevance of Bitcoin in times when the general public loses trust in traditional financial institutions. More than that, the study outlines the global trend aimed at making digital money easier for the masses. The study suggests it took 21 years for mobile phones to reach the 300 million users mark. The count begins with 1972, when the first cellular mobile phone was used. The same amount of users was reached by the Internet in 15 years, starting with 1983, the official year of the Internet creation. On top of the questionability of the dates chosen as the starting dates for the Internet and mobile phone adoption expressed by Brian Armstrong, some people question the methodology used to count the number of Bitcoin users. What counts as a user in this? I think it might be the number of addresses, but keep in mind that many of these haven't been touched in years. Also, one person can have more than one address. In fact, because of Bitcoin's poor privacy, many people create a new address every‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/imYux7SWIr ‚Äî Victor (@VictorMoneroXMR) February 9, 2025 The study doesn‚Äôt reveal the source of the number of Bitcoin users and what are the criteria for someone to fit the ‚ÄòBitcoin user‚Äô definition. Other studies According to the Chainalysis article, in December 2018, of 460 million Bitcoin addresses, only 172 million addresses had economic relevancy . The article notes that 25 million addresses were associated with private holders, while the rest were the addresses of exchanges, dark web marketplaces, and other platforms. This data refers to the times when Bitcoin was ten years old. The number of addresses doesn‚Äôt represent the actual number of Bitcoin users or owners, as one person can have a potentially infinite amount of addresses. In contrast, the addresses used on exchanges may be used by several people simultaneously. The BiTBO findings show that only around 106 million people own Bitcoin as of 2025. It is not clear if BlackRock considers ex-owners to be Bitcoin users. According to the study, Bitcoin is used by a mere 500k people a day. For comparison, Visa processes over 700 million transactions daily. Although the Bitcoin network does substantially fewer transactions than traditional payment operators, it allegedly outperforms both Visa and MasterCard in terms of the combined daily value of operated transactions. Bitcoin sends approximately $46.4 billion per day, while Visa operates around $38.9 billion per day, and MasterCard transacts around $24.7 billion each day. Does Armstrong‚Äôs prediction look realistic? Comparing Bitcoin to cell phones in terms of adoption is pretty hard, considering that phones are getting increasingly cheaper while Bitcoin is getting more expensive. The modern-day services are designed for smartphone owners, while Bitcoin enthusiasts have to look for opportunities to buy, store, or spend crypto in spite of hurdles. At large, these differences can be attributed to the fact that Bitcoin is much younger than the first commercially available cell phone that hit the market in 1984. More than that, cellphones were never deemed ‚Äòcrime telephones‚Äô or something like this, while Bitcoin is still seen as drug money or a tool for money laundering and corruption by some. Bitcoin is a tough war on the part of several governments, but that‚Äôs not something that mobile phones have gone through. It took around 30 years for cell phones to become ubiquitous. By 2014, the number of active cell phones had reached around 7 billion. By 2005, when mobile phones were on the market for 21 years, over 60% of adults in the U.S. owned them. In 2030, Bitcoin will be 21 years old, and it doesn‚Äôt seem that it will be as widespread as cell phones in 2005. It takes great effort from regulators and businesses around the world to make Bitcoin as simple and safe to use as mobile phones to make billions of people use it. El Salvador made a bold move by making Bitcoin a legal tender. Still, it retreated after a three-and-a-half-year experiment with data showing that most residents didn‚Äôt even try to use Bitcoins despite the fact that it was legal and encouraged by the government. This lesson shows that despite Bitcoin seeming handy and prosperous to crypto industry professionals, for the masses, using Bitcoin is still a challenge. Considering how bullish on Bitcoin the governments and corporations are, the adoption may see vertical rise soon, however, the existing challenges cannot be ignored.
